title: SAML SSO in Bitrise
body: Velocity and Enterprise users can create and log in to a Bitrise Workspace using their own SAML SSO provider’s system to provide an extra layer of security.

title: SAML SSO in Bitrise
body: Workspace members can log in to a Bitrise Workspace using their own SAML SSO provider’s system. With SAML SSO, Workspaces will be able to apply the security guidelines of their SAML SSO provider when accessing their Bitrise Workspace.

title: SAML SSO in Bitrise
body: Before connecting SAML SSO to your Workspace, make sure:

title: SAML SSO in Bitrise
body: You have a SAML SSO provider (Identity Provider) that you can connect Bitrise to and the administrator to the SAML SSO provider is at hand.

title: SAML SSO in Bitrise
body: Your account on Bitrise has a Velocity or an Enterprise Build Platform plan. If it doesn’t have a Workspace, go ahead and create one. Setting up SAML SSO is the same for existing and brand new Workspaces on Bitrise.

title: SAML SSO in Bitrise
body: Only the Workspace owner can set up SAML SSO to a Bitrise Workspace.

title: Navigating to the Single Sign-On page of Bitrise
body: If you are a Workspace owner on Bitrise, you will have to use the Single Sign-On tab to set up a SAML SSO connection between your SAML SSO provider and your Bitrise Workspace.

title: Navigating to the Single Sign-On page of Bitrise
body: Log in to Bitrise and hover over the left navigation bar.

title: Navigating to the Single Sign-On page of Bitrise
body: Make sure you have the right workspace selected in the Workspace menu.

title: Navigating to the Single Sign-On page of Bitrise
body: Select Settings.

title: Navigating to the Single Sign-On page of Bitrise
body: On the left menu bar, click Single Sign-On which will take you to the Single Sign-On page.

title: Navigating to the Single Sign-On page of Bitrise
body: Continue with setting up SAML SSO for your Workspace on Bitrise.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: Once the Workspace owner has set up SAML SSO, everyone in the Workspace has to authorize SAML SSO before logging in to their Workspace via SAML SSO.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: Make sure you’re logged into Bitrise in the usual way. Use the same browser window to continue.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: Bitrise sends a verification e-mail to all Workspace members. By clicking the Log In via SAML SSO button or using the provided URL, Workspace members can authorize themselves for SAML SSO login. The email also shows the Workspace owner’s email address (should you need to contact them.) Click the Log In via SAML SSO button or copy-paste the URL to a NEW TAB of the same browser.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: You’re directed to Bitrise to Allow “Workspace name” to sign you in page.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: Click Authorize if you trust the Workspace to control your Bitrise account sign-in process.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: If you’re already logged in to your SAML SSO provider, you’ll be automatically taken to your Bitrise Dashboard.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: If you’re not, you’ll be prompted to log in on your SAML SSO provider’s site, and then taken to your Bitrise Dashboard.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: Click Don’t Allow if the invitation email is from an untrusted source.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: Note that if you are using a different non-matching email address, you will get the below error message. Make sure you log in with the right email address both on Bitrise, as well as on your SSO provider site.

title: Authorizing SAML SSO
body: If all went well, you should be landing on our Bitrise Dashboard.

title: Joining a SAML SSO Workspace as a new member
body: If a Bitrise Workspace owner invites you to a Workspace, you should get an email invitation to join the Workspace via SAML SSO. Let’s see how!

title: Joining a SAML SSO Workspace as a new member
body: Go to your mailbox and find our email titled Saml invitation instructions.

title: Joining a SAML SSO Workspace as a new member
body: Click the Sign in via SSO button or copy the provided URL and paste it into a new browser. Our Almost there page appears.

title: Joining a SAML SSO Workspace as a new member
body: Provide a Username you would like to use in your Bitrise Workspace. Please use only letters, numbers, underscores (_), dashes (-) and dots (.) in your username. The Email field is non-editable.

title: Joining a SAML SSO Workspace as a new member
body: Click the Finish Sign-up button. If all went well, you’re landing on Bitrise and can add your first app.

title: Checking SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise
body: Now that the Workspace owner has set up SAML SSO for the Workspace, all Workspace members (including the Workspace owner) can check their other Workspace member’s SAML SSO statuses on the Team tab.

title: Checking SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise
body: Accessing the Single Sign-on tab

title: Checking SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise
body: The Single Sign-On tab is only available for the Workspace owner.

title: Checking SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise
body: There are two kinds of SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise.

title: Checking SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise
body: SAML IS ENABLED: Login via SAML SSO is enabled.

title: Checking SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise
body: SAML IS DISABLED: The Workspace member has not enabled the SAML SSO connection yet. To enable it, the Workspace member has to follow the instructions in the verification email from Bitrise.

title: Checking SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise
body: Go to your Workspace’s profile page.

title: Checking SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise
body: Select Team from the left menu.

title: Checking SAML SSO statuses on Bitrise
body: Go to the Members tab to check the Workspace member’s SAML status.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Enforcing SAML SSO on your Workspace provides an extra layer of security: you can enforce your own security guidelines to your Bitrise Workspace (for example, password format requirements, two-factor authentication).

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Enforced SAML SSO

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Enforcing SAML SSO in your Workspace makes SAML SSO the only way for logging in/signing up to the Workspace.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: One Workspace only

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: You cannot be a member in two Workspaces that enforced SAML SSO on Bitrise.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Log in to Bitrise and hover over the left navigation bar.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Make sure you have the right workspace selected in the Workspace menu.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Select Settings.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Go to your Workspace’s Single Sign On tab.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Check the Enforce SAML SSO checkbox to enforce SAML SSO.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Unable to enforce SAML SSO

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: A Workspace owner cannot enforce SAML SSO on the Workspace if Workspace members have not enabled their SAML SSO connection yet or they enabled SAML SSO with another Workspace that enforces SAML SSO.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Click Save changes.

title: Enforcing SAML SSO on a Workspace
body: Now Workspace members can only log in via SAML SSO.

title: Adding a new user to a Workspace with enforced SAML SSO
body: Once SAML SSO is enforced on a Workspace, you can still add new users to it. But in this case, it's important to differentiate between the two types of new users:

title: Adding a new user to a Workspace with enforced SAML SSO
body: Users with existing accounts on Bitrise: We recommend that the Workspace admin turns off the enforced SSO and invites the user to the Workspace. The invited Bitrise user has to go through the invitation process and enable their SSO connection. Once that is done, the Workspace admin can turn the Enforce SSO switch back on.

title: Adding a new user to a Workspace with enforced SAML SSO
body: Users who are new to Bitrise and haven't registered an account yet: The Workspace admin doesn't need to turn off enforced SSO: simply invite the new user who should then complete the sign-up procedure as described: Joining a SAML SSO Workspace as a new member.

title: Adding a new user to a Workspace with enforced SAML SSO
body: Alternatively, the new user can go directly to the sign-up page, and click the SAML button then follow the instructions to achieve the same goal.

title: Logging in via SAML SSO
body: If the SAML SSO connection has been already added to your Workspace and you have enabled your SAML SSO connection too, you can easily log in to your Bitrise account without having to use a password and email address.

title: Logging in via SAML SSO
body: Expired SAML SSO certificate

title: Logging in via SAML SSO
body: If your SAML SSO certificate has expired, and you cannot log into Bitrise through SAML SSO, you can contact our Support team to help you log in.

title: Logging in via SAML SSO
body: Click Login via SSO on our login page.

title: Logging in via SAML SSO
body: You will be redirected to the Initiate Single Sign-On page.

title: Logging in via SAML SSO
body: Provide your Workspace name in the Bitrise Workspace’s Name field.

title: Logging in via SAML SSO
body: Click Continue with SSO to log in.

title: Logging in via SAML SSO
body: If you’re logged in on your SSO provider site, you will be automatically landing on your Bitrise Dashboard.

title: Logging in via SAML SSO
body: If you’re logged out on your SSO provider site, you will be redirected there to log in. After the successful login, you will be redirected to your Bitrise dashboard.

title: Disabling a Workspace's SAML SSO
body: If you disable SAML SSO, Workspace members will be able to sign in with the regular sign-in procedure.

title: Disabling a Workspace's SAML SSO
body: Log in to Bitrise and hover over the left navigation bar.

title: Disabling a Workspace's SAML SSO
body: Make sure you have the right workspace selected in the Workspace menu.

title: Disabling a Workspace's SAML SSO
body: Select Settings.

title: Disabling a Workspace's SAML SSO
body: Go to the Single Sign-On tab.

title: Disabling a Workspace's SAML SSO
body: If SAML SSO has been enforced on the Workspace before, toggle Enforce under Enforce SAML SSO off.

title: Disabling a Workspace's SAML SSO
body: Click Disable SSO.

title: Disabling a Workspace's SAML SSO
body: A confirmation pop-up appears where you can confirm/cancel your action. Please note that by clicking the Disable SSO button, you will disable SAML SSO for all Workspace members. Once it’s done, Workspace members will be able to log in through their normal Bitrise credentials.

title: Disabling a Workspace's SAML SSO
body: You will receive an SSO has been disabled email from Bitrise (letsconnect@bitrise.io) which confirms the disabled SAML SSO for the Workspace.

title: Disabling a Workspace member's SAML SSO
body: If you are a Workspace owner, you can disable a Workspace member’s SAML SSO connection to the Workspace on Bitrise. There are two ways to do so:

title: Disabling a Workspace member's SAML SSO
body: Remove the user from the Workspace.

title: Disabling a Workspace member's SAML SSO
body: Remove the user from the SAML SSO provider which means the user would not be able to log in with SAML SSO any more.

title: Updating SAML SSO configuration
body: You can update a Workspace’s configured SAML SSO using the Configure SAML SSO provider button on the Single Sign-On page.

title: Updating SAML SSO configuration
body: This comes in handy if your SAML SSO provider’s certificate has expired and you wish to insert the new certificate on Bitrise. Another use case is, for example, if SAML SSO has been configured a while ago and now you wish to check the current configuration details.

title: Updating SAML SSO configuration
body: Accessing the Update SSO button

title: Updating SAML SSO configuration
body: As with other SAML SSO configurations, only the Workspace owner can access and use the Update SSO button.

title: Updating SAML SSO configuration
body: As the owner of the Workspace, click your Workspace’s Single Sing-On tab.

title: Updating SAML SSO configuration
body: Click the Configure SAML SSO provider button. Now you can access the configuration details of Workspace’s SAML SSO.

title: Updating SAML SSO configuration
body: Make the changes and click Save changes.

title: Updating SAML SSO configuration
body: From now on any SAML SSO request will use the new configuration automatically.

title: Configuring SCIM
body: The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) specification is designed to make managing user identities in cloud-based applications and services easier. On Bitrise, SCIM provisioning is supported for Okta and Microsoft Entra ID.

title: Configuring SCIM
body: The System for Cross-domain Identity Management (SCIM) specification is designed to make managing user identities in cloud-based applications and services easier.

title: Configuring SCIM
body: On Bitrise, SCIM provisioning is supported for Okta and Microsoft Entra ID.

title: Configuring SCIM
body: SCIM provisioning requires a verified domain, and SCIM credentials: a SCIM base URL and an authentication token. The process of configuring these on Bitrise is the same for both Okta and Entra ID:

title: Configuring SCIM
body: Configuring domain control.

title: Configuring SCIM
body: Generating SCIM credentials.

title: Configuring domain control
body: You can add and verify your corporate domains from where you will manage Bitrise users. You can have multiple verified domains on Bitrise but you can only add one domain at a time. Multiple subdomains of the same domain count as different domains as Bitrise expects an exact match.

title: Configuring domain control
body: Log in to Bitrise and hover over the left navigation bar.

title: Configuring domain control
body: Make sure you have the right workspace selected in the Workspace menu.

title: Configuring domain control
body: Select Settings.

title: Configuring domain control
body: On the left, select Single sign-on.

title: Configuring domain control
body: Select the SCIM tab.

title: Configuring domain control
body: In the Domain control section, click Add domain.

title: Configuring domain control
body: Enter your domain name in the dialog box, and click Next.

title: Configuring domain control
body: Handling subdomains

title: Configuring domain control
body: Bitrise expects an exact match for the domain names. If you use subdomains, you need to add the full name of the subdomain. For example, if you own mydomain.com and you want to use its subdomain external.mydomain.com, you should write it out the subdomain's naame when setting up domain control on Bitrise.

title: Configuring domain control
body: You will see a domain verification code. You need to add this code to as a DNS TXT record at your domain provider.

title: Configuring domain control
body: Click Copy and close to copy the verification code and close the dialog box.

title: Configuring domain control
body: After you've added the DNS TXT record at your domain provider, we'll commence domain verification. This can take up to 72 hours. You will receive an email once it is completed. Once that is done, you can proceed to setting up SCIM credentials.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: Once you have a verified domain set up on Bitrise, you can set up SCIM credentials to connect to Okta.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: Log in to Bitrise and hover over the left navigation bar.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: Make sure you have the right workspace selected in the Workspace menu.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: Select Settings.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: On the left, select Single sign-on.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: Select the SCIM tab.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: In the SCIM credentials section, click Generate SCIM credentials to open the SCIM credentials dialog box.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: Save your SCIM credentials. In the dialog box, you will see:

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: Your SCIM base URL.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: Your SCIM authentication token.

title: Generating SCIM credentials
body: Copy and save both. You need them for SCIM provisioning. For Okta, check out our SCIM provisioning guide.

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: Add SAML SSO to your Bitrise Workspace using Google Workspace.

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: This guide provides step-by-step instructions on setting up Bitrise as a SAML application on Google Workspace.

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO restrictions

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO is only available for a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise Build plans.

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: Since the SAML SSO feature is tied to the above plans, if you decide to downgrade, you will lose this feature. All Workspace members will receive an email about the downgrade and you’ll have two weeks to re-upgrade if you wish to use SAML SSO in your Workspace again.

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: Before connecting SAML SSO to your Workspace:

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: Make sure you have a Google administrator account where you can add Bitrise as a SAML app. The Google Workspace administrator can help setting up SAML SSO on Google Workspace.

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: Be aware that only the Workspace owner can set up SAML SSO to a Bitrise Workspace.

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: Your account on Bitrise has a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise plan.

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: You'll need to:

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: Get configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise.

title: Setting up Google SSO for Bitrise
body: Enable the Bitrise app for a group or an organizational unit.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Sign into your Google Admin Console.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Select Apps on the Admin Console page.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: On the Apps page, click SAML apps.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: On the Web and mobile apps page, click the Add apps button, and select the Add custom SAML app option from the dropdown.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: On the App details page add Bitrise as your app name. Please note it must be Bitrise as no other format is accepted. Click Continue.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: On the Getting Identity Provider details page:

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Copy the SSO URL and paste it on the SAML SSO provider Single Sing-On URL (SSO URL) on Bitrise.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Copy the whole content of the Certificate field and paste it in the SAML SSO provider certificate field of Bitrise. You can upload the Certificate from your local computer too.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: While you are in Bitrise, click the Copy Link button to copy the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL). We will need it on Google Workspace in a second. Let’s NOT click the Configure SSO button just now!

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Let’s head back to the Getting Identity Provider details page of Google Workspace. Click Continue.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: On the Service provider details page:

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Paste the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL) of Bitrise in the ACS URL field on Google Workspace. (Remember, we got the link at Step 7.)

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Type Bitrise in the Entity ID field. Please note it must be Bitrise as no other format is accepted.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Tick the Signed response checkbox under START URL (optional).

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Click CONTINUE.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: Click the Configure SSO button on Bitrise.

title: Getting configuration information from Google Workspace and Bitrise
body: On Google Workspace’s Attribute mapping page, click Finish - you do not have to configure anything here.

title: Enabling Bitrise app for a group or an organizational unit
body: All there is left to do on G Suite is to enable the newly created Bitrise app for a group or organization of your choice.

title: Enabling Bitrise app for a group or an organizational unit
body: Go to the Web and mobile apps page on G Suite and select Bitrise from the Apps list.

title: Enabling Bitrise app for a group or an organizational unit
body: Click User access to get to the Service status page.

title: Enabling Bitrise app for a group or an organizational unit
body: Select ON for everyone and hit Save.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Add SAML SSO to your Bitrise Workspace using Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: This guide provides step-by-step instructions on setting up SAML SSO using Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services (AD FS).

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO restrictions

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO is only available for a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise Build plans.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Since the SAML SSO feature is tied to the above plans, if you decide to downgrade, you will lose this feature. All Workspace members will receive an email about the downgrade and you’ll have two weeks to re-upgrade if you wish to use SAML SSO in your Workspace again.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Before connecting SAML SSO to your Workspace:

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Make sure the AD FS administrator is at hand during the SAML SSO configuration process.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Be aware that only the Workspace owner can set up SAML SSO to a Bitrise Workspace.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Your account on Bitrise has a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise plan.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: In this tutorial we will be jumping back and forth between Bitrise and AD FS so it is recommended that both tools are available during this process.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: To configure SAML SSO with AD FS, you'll need to:

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Add the Identity provider sign-on URL from AD FS on Bitrise.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Export a certificate generated by AD FS and add it on Bitrise.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Add Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS.

title: Setting up AD FS SSO for Bitrise
body: Configure claim rules.

title: Adding the identity provider sign-on URL
body: Log in to Bitrise and hover over the left navigation bar.

title: Adding the identity provider sign-on URL
body: Make sure you have the right workspace selected in the Workspace menu.

title: Adding the identity provider sign-on URL
body: Select Settings.

title: Adding the identity provider sign-on URL
body: Go to the Single Sign-on tab.

title: Adding the identity provider sign-on URL
body: Add the Identity provider sign-on URL from AD FS in the SAML SSO provider Single Sign-On URL (SSO URL) field.

title: Adding the identity provider sign-on URL
body: For example, a valid value is https://<AD FS URL>.com/adfs/ls.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: You have to add a certificate generated by AD FS to the SAML SSO provider certificate field of the Single Sign-On page on Bitrise. If you’ve already created a certificate on AD FS, you can export it in PEM format from the AD FS server. If you haven’t created one yet, follow the instructions: Obtain and Configure TS and TD Certificates for AD FS.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: In Server Manager, click Tools, and select AD FS Management.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Select the Certificates folder on the left menu pane.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Click a certificate under Token-signing. This brings up the Certificates window.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Click Details tab on the Certificate page.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Hit Next on the Certificate Export Wizard window.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Select the Base-64 encoded X.509 (.CER) the export file format. Click Next.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Give it a name in the File name field and hit Save.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Have a final look at your certificate settings. If you need to modify any of those, click the backward arrow next to Certificate Export Wizard. Otherwise, click Finish. Make sure you leave the AD FS window open as you will need it in a minute.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Open the exported certificate by a text editor and copy/paste its content to the SAML SSO provider certificate field or upload the file itself from your local computer.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Save the settings by clicking Configure SSO on Bitrise.

title: Exporting an AD FS certificate
body: Let’s continue the SAML SSO configuration on AD FS by adding Bitrise.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: Once you are finished with exporting the certificate, you can continue with adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS. The Add Relying Party Trust Wizard guides you through the steps.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On AD FS, click Relying Party Trust on the left menu bar, then click Relying Party Trust.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: Select Add Relying Party Trust under Actions.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Welcome page, select the Claims aware option and hit Start.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Select Data Source page, click the Enter data about the relying party manually option on the bottom of the page. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Specify Display Name page, add a Display name, for example MyCorp. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: Specify a token encryption certificate on the Configure Certificate page is optional. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Configure URL page, select Enable support for the SAML 2.0 WebSSO protocol and copy paste the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL) from Bitrise to the Relying party SAML 2. 0 SSO service URL field on AD FS. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Configure Identifiers page, add Bitrise in the Relying party trust identifier field. Click Add, then hit Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: Do not modify the default access control policy on the Choose Access Control Policy page so that everyone can access this SAML SSO connection. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Ready to Add Trust page, review the settings and click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Finish page, tick the checkbox to edit claims issuance policy for Bitrise. Click Close.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On AD FS, click Relying Party Trust on the left menu bar, then click Relying Party Trust.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: Select Add Relying Party Trust under Actions.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Welcome page, select the Claims aware option and hit Start.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Select Data Source page, click the Enter data about the relying party manually option on the bottom of the page. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Specify Display Name page, add a Display name, for example MyCorp. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: Specify a token encryption certificate on the Configure Certificate page is optional. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Configure URL page, select Enable support for the SAML 2.0 WebSSO protocol and copy paste the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL) from Bitrise to the Relying party SAML 2. 0 SSO service URL field on AD FS. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Configure Identifiers page, add Bitrise in the Relying party trust identifier field. Click Add, then hit Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: Do not modify the default access control policy on the Choose Access Control Policy page so that everyone can access this SAML SSO connection. Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Ready to Add Trust page, review the settings and click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise as a relying party trust to AD FS
body: On the Finish page, tick the checkbox to edit claims issuance policy for Bitrise. Click Close.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: On the Edit Claim Issuance Policy page, click the Add Rule button and hit OK.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Create a Send LDAP Attributes as Claims claim rule and click Next.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: On the Configure Claim Rule page:

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Add a rule name, for example Send E-mail, in the Claim rule name field.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Select an Attribute Store which is most likely the Active Directory.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: In the Mapping of LDAP attributes to outgoing claim types field select E-mail Addresses.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Click Finish.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Add another new rule that turns an E-mail to a formatter NameID. To do so, click Add rule in the Edit Claim Issuance Policy page again.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: On the Select Rule Template, select Transform an Incoming Claim option in the Claim rule template dropdown. Click Next.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Give a name to the new rule, for example, Transform E-mail.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Select E-Mail Address as the Incoming Claim Type.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Select NameId as the Outgoing claim type.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Choose Email as the Outgoing name ID format.

title: Configuring claim rules
body: Hit OK to finish the process.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: Add SAML SSO to your Bitrise Workspace using Auth0.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: This guide provides instructions on setting up SAML SSO using Auth0.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO restrictions

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO is only available for a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise Build plans.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: Since the SAML SSO feature is tied to the above plans, if you decide to downgrade, you will lose this feature. All Workspace members will receive an email about the downgrade and you’ll have two weeks to re-upgrade if you wish to use SAML SSO in your Workspace again.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: Before connecting SAML SSO to your Workspace:

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: An Auth0 administrator who is logged into Auth0 is at hand.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: Be aware that only the Workspace owner can set up SAML SSO to a Bitrise Workspace.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: Your account on Bitrise has a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise plan.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: You will need to:

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: Create Bitrise as a web application on Auth0.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: Retrieve SAML SSO information from Auth0.

title: Setting up Auth0 SSO for Bitrise
body: Setting up a mapping rule for your Bitrise app's Client ID.

title: Creating Bitrise as a web application on Auth0
body: Log into Auth0 as an admin.

title: Creating Bitrise as a web application on Auth0
body: Click Applications on the left menu bar then click the + Create Application button on the right hand side of the Applications page.

title: Creating Bitrise as a web application on Auth0
body: On the Create application window, type Bitrise in the Name field. In the Choose application type select Regular Web Applications, and click the Create button.

title: Creating Bitrise as a web application on Auth0
body: You are landing on your newly created Bitrise app’s Quick Start page. Click the Addons tab. Toggle the SAML2 WEB APP’s switch to the right. This will take to to the Addon: SAML2 WEB APP page automatically.

title: Creating Bitrise as a web application on Auth0
body: Copy the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL) from Bitrise and paste it into the Application Callback URL field on the Settings tab of the Addon: SAML2 WEB APP page. Scroll down to the bottom of the Addon: SAML2 WEB APP page and hit SAVE.

title: Creating Bitrise as a web application on Auth0
body: Go back to the Addons page where you can find the switch turned on.

title: Retrieving SAML SSO information from Auth0
body: Once you have enabled Bitrise as a web application on Auth0, it’s time to grab the certificate and the Identity provider’s unique login URL to finish up the SAML configuration on Bitrise.

title: Retrieving SAML SSO information from Auth0
body: On Auth0, go to Application, then select the Addons tab to find your enabled Bitrise app.

title: Retrieving SAML SSO information from Auth0
body: Click the SAML2 WEB APP web app and select the Usage tab. Click on the Download Auth0 certificate link next to the Identity Provider Certificate label. Open the downloaded certificate file and copy its content into the SAML SSO provider certificate field of Bitrise or upload the file itself from your local computer. Go back to Auth0 and copy paste the Identity Provider Login URL into Bitrise’s SAML SSO provider Single Sign-On URL (SSO URL).

title: Retrieving SAML SSO information from Auth0
body: Click Configure SSO button on Bitrise.

title: Retrieving SAML SSO information from Auth0
body: Now you can close the dialog on Auth0.

title: Setting up a mapping rule for your Bitrise app’s Client ID
body: Bitrise authenticates SAML SSO users via email address so before you’d test SAML SSO, make sure you create a new mapping rule on Auth0. This way you map Auth0 Client ID to email for successful SAML authentication on Bitrise.

title: Setting up a mapping rule for your Bitrise app’s Client ID
body: On Auth0, click the Auth Pipeline on the left menu bar. Click Rules.

title: Setting up a mapping rule for your Bitrise app’s Client ID
body: Click + Create to set up a new mapping rule.

title: Setting up a mapping rule for your Bitrise app’s Client ID
body: On the Pick a rules template page, click <> Empty rule.

title: Setting up a mapping rule for your Bitrise app’s Client ID
body: Add the following codeblock to the Script box: You will need your new Bitrise app’s Client ID which you can get on the Applications’ page.

title: Setting up a mapping rule for your Bitrise app’s Client ID
Setting up a mapping rule for your Bitrise app’s Client ID
body: Click Save changes.

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: Add SAML SSO to your Bitrise Workspace using Microsoft Entra ID.

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO restrictions

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO is only available for a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise Build plans.

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: Since the SAML SSO feature is tied to the above plans, if you decide to downgrade, you will lose this feature. All Workspace members will receive an email about the downgrade and you’ll have two weeks to re-upgrade if you wish to use SAML SSO in your Workspace again.

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: Before connecting SAML SSO to your Workspace:

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: Make sure an Entra ID administrator who is logged into Entra ID is at hand.

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: Be aware that only the Workspace owner can set up SAML SSO to a Bitrise Workspace.

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: Your account on Bitrise has a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise plan.

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: You will need to:

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: Add Bitrise to Entra ID as a new application.

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: Add users and groups to the Bitrise app on Entra ID.

title: Setting up Entra ID (former Azure AD) SSO for Bitrise
body: Set up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID.

title: Adding Bitrise to Entra ID as a new application
body: Log into Microsoft Azure as an admin.

title: Adding Bitrise to Entra ID as a new application
body: Click the Azure Active Directory icon on the Azure services page.

title: Adding Bitrise to Entra ID as a new application
body: Click Enterprise applications under Manage.

title: Adding Bitrise to Entra ID as a new application
body: Click New Application to add Bitrise as a new app to your account.

title: Adding Bitrise to Entra ID as a new application
body: Type Bitrise in the What’s the name of your app? field. The Integrate any other application you don’t find in the gallery button should be automatically selected. Hit Create.

title: Adding Bitrise to Entra ID as a new application
body: You will find your newly created app listed on the All Applications page.

title: Adding Bitrise to Entra ID as a new application
body: Click the Bitrise app to go to its Overview page.

title: Adding Bitrise to Entra ID as a new application
body: Continue with configuring Bitrise as a SAML app.

title: Adding users/ groups to the app on Entra ID
body: Before setting up SAML to the app, you have to add all the users/groups to the app in Entra ID who will use SAML SSO to log into the Bitrise Workspace. In other words, every Bitrise Workspace member must be added as user in Entra ID.

title: Adding users/ groups to the app on Entra ID
body: Select Users and groups from the left menu.

title: Adding users/ groups to the app on Entra ID
body: Click + Add user/group.

title: Adding users/ groups to the app on Entra ID
body: On the Users page of Add Assignment, select users from the list and click Select. Once it’s done, you can select a role for users under the Select a role dropdown.

title: Adding users/ groups to the app on Entra ID
body: On the Add Assignment page, click Assign to finish adding users.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Click Single sign-on on the left menu. Select SAML.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: You will land on the Set up Single Sign-On with SAML page.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Click the pencil symbol at Basic SAML Configuration to edit two fields.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Add Bitrise as the Identifier (Entity ID). Leave this window open! We will come back to it with some information from Bitrise in a second.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Head back to your Workspace on Bitrise.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Click the Single Sign On tab and click the Copy Link button to copy the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL) from Bitrise.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Let’s head back to the Basic SAML Configuration window of Entra ID.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Paste the Assertion Consumer Service URL from Bitrise to the Reply URL field on the Basic SAML Configuration page of Entra ID.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Click Save and close the Basic SAML Configuration window.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: On the Single sign-on page of Entra ID, scroll down to the Set up Bitrise section.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Copy the Login URL and paste it to the SAML SSO provider Single Sign-On URL (SSO URL) field on Bitrise.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: On the Single sign-on page of Entra ID, scroll up a bit to the SAML Signing Certificate section.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Click Download next to Certificate (Base64) to download the certificate to your local computer.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Open the certificate file and copy/paste its content into the SAML SSO provider certificate field of Bitrise or you can upload the file itself from your local computer too.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: (If manually adding the content, you will need the full content (including ----BEGIN CERTIFICATE----- and -----END CERTIFICATE----- as well).

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: Hit Configure SSO on Bitrise.

title: Setting up SAML SSO between Bitrise and Entra ID
body: You have successfully set up Bitrise as a SAML SSO app on Entra ID.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Add SAML SSO to your Bitrise Workspace using Idaptive.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: This guide provides step-by-step instructions on setting up Bitrise as a SAML application on Idaptive.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO restrictions

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO is only available for a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise Build plans.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Since the SAML SSO feature is tied to the above plans, if you decide to downgrade, you will lose this feature. All Workspace members will receive an email about the downgrade and you’ll have two weeks to re-upgrade if you wish to use SAML SSO in your Workspace again.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Before connecting SAML SSO to your Workspace:

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Be aware that only the Workspace owner can set up SAML SSO to a Bitrise Workspace.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Your account on Bitrise has a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise plan.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: You must be logged into your Admin Portal on Idaptive to set up Bitrise as a SAML SSO app and establish the connection between Bitrise and Idaptive. If you are using the User Portal, Switch to Admin Portal by clicking your avatar on Idaptive.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Log into Idaptive as an Admin.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Go to Apps, then to Web Apps. Click the Add Web Apps button on the right.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: On the Custom tab and select SAML, and click Add. On the Add Web App popup hit Yes. Close the window. You will be automatically directed to the Settings page.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Add Bitrise to the Name and Application ID fields on the Settings page and click Save.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Click Trust on the left menu bar and select the Manual configuration under Identity Provider Configuration.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Click the Signing Certificate dropdown and download the certificate. Open it with a text editor so that you can copy the full content of the certificate. You can also upload the file.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Insert the content or upload the file itself in the SAML SSO provider certificate text box on the Enable Single Sign-On page of Bitrise.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Copy the Single Sign On URL from the Trust page of Idaptive. Insert it on the SAML SSO provider Single Sing-On URL (SSO URL) field on the Enable Single Sign-On page of Bitrise.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: While on the Single Sign-On page of Bitrise, copy the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL) URL and click Configure SSO.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Now let’s head back to Idaptive! Under Service Provider Configuration click Manual Configuration. Type Bitrise in the SP Entity ID / Issuer / Audience and paste the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL) from Bitrise to the Assertion Consumer Service (ACS) URL on Idaptive.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Scroll down to NameID Format and select emailAddress. Click Save.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: Go to Permissions and click the Add button. In the Select User, Group, or Role popup, type the user name you want to add to the SAML app. Select it and hit Add. Save your changes. This will change the status of your Bitrise SAML app to Deployed.

title: Setting up Idaptive SAML SSO for Bitrise
body: You are now ready to use Idaptive as your SAML SSO provider on Bitrise.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: Add SAML SSO to your Bitrise Workspace using Okta.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: This guide provides step-by-step instructions on setting up Bitrise as a SAML application on Okta.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO restrictions

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO is only available for a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise Build plans.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: Since the SAML SSO feature is tied to the above plans, if you decide to downgrade, you will lose this feature. All Workspace members will receive an email about the downgrade and you’ll have two weeks to re-upgrade if you wish to use SAML SSO in your Workspace again.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: Before connecting SAML SSO to your Workspace:

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: Make sure you have an Okta administrator who is logged into Okta at hand.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: Be aware that only the Workspace owner can set up SAML SSO to a Bitrise Workspace.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: Your account on Bitrise has a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise plan.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: Add Bitrise to Okta.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: Configure Bitrise as a SAML app.

title: Setting up Okta SSO for Bitrise
body: Set up SCIM previsioning in Okta.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Bitrise is not an integrated app in Okta. You have to add Bitrise manually to Okta first, then you can configure SAML SSO on it.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: We will be jumping back and forth from the Bitrise Workspace account to Okta so make sure both pages are available. In practice this means the Workspace owner should be logged into Bitrise and the Okta admin should be logged into Okta.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Log into Okta and click Admin.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: From the left menu, select Applications under the Applications section.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Click on the Create App Integration button.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: This opens the Create a new app integration window.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Select SAML 2.0 option as the Sign-in method and click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: At the General Settings step, type Bitrise into the App name field. (Optionally, you can add an app logo if you wish.) Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Head over to your Bitrise Workspace and click the Single Sign On tab on the left menu.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Click the Copy button to copy the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL).

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Head back to Okta’s Configure SAML page and paste the copied URL from Step 7. to the Single sign-on URL input field.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Type Bitrise at the Audience URI (SP Entity ID).

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: You can download the Okta certificate file now, and paste its content or upload the file itself in the SAML SSO provider certificate field on your Bitrise Workspace’s Single Sign-On page. Even easier if you leave it for later as you will need to fill out the Assertion Consumer Service URL (ACS URL) on Bitrise anyway. You will fetch this while configuring Bitrise as a SAML app on Okta. Do not hit Configure SSO on the Single Sing-On page of Bitrise just yet.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Set the Name ID format to EmailAddress.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Click Next.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Fill out the Feedback section. Hit Finish.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: In Applications, go to the Sign-on tab, and click Edit next to Settings.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Scroll down to the Credential Details section, and make sure that Application username format is set to Email.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Click Save.

title: Adding Bitrise to Okta
body: Congrats! Bitrise has been successfully added to Okta as an app.

title: Configuring Bitrise as a SAML app for Okta
body: Click the Assignments tab of your Bitrise app.

title: Configuring Bitrise as a SAML app for Okta
body: Here you can assign Bitrise to individuals/groups. Make sure you assign Bitrise to all Workspace members who will access the Bitrise Workspace through SAML.

title: Configuring Bitrise as a SAML app for Okta
body: Click the Sign-On tab of your Bitrise app. You will see that SAML setup is not completed yet. Scroll down, and click View SAML setup instructions.

title: Configuring Bitrise as a SAML app for Okta
body: The How to Configure SAML 2.0 for Bitrise application page is displayed. It summarizes all the information you need to set up the SAML connection between Bitrise and Okta.

title: Configuring Bitrise as a SAML app for Okta
body: Copy the Identity Provider Single Sign-On URL and paste it in your Bitrise Workspace’s SSO URL field.

title: Configuring Bitrise as a SAML app for Okta
body: If you haven’t pasted the Certificate’s content or uploaded the file itself into the SAML SSO provider certificate field of your Bitrise Workspace yet, you can do so now.

title: Configuring Bitrise as a SAML app for Okta
body: Click Configure SSO on your Bitrise Workspace.

title: Configuring Bitrise as a SAML app for Okta
body: That's it! From now on, whenever you access the Single Sign-on page, you can configure the SAML SSO settings.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: You can set up SCIM provisioning for Bitrise using Okta.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Managing Workspace groups

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: While SCIM is a great way to manage the access of your users for Bitrise Workspaces, you will have to do some initial configuration for your groups in Bitrise after finishing setting up the SCIM provisioning. For more information about configuring your groups, check out Adding Workspace groups to a project team.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: We will be jumping back and forth from the Bitrise Workspace account to Okta, so make sure both pages are available. In practice, this means the Workspace owner should be logged into Bitrise, and the Okta admin should be logged in to Okta.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: On Bitrise, configure domain control and generate your SCIM credentials. You need to have:

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: A verified domain.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: An SCIM base URL and an SCIM authentication token.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Make sure you save both of these because you will need them during the process later.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Log into Okta and click Admin.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: From the left menu, select Applications under the Applications section.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Select your Bitrise app.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Click the General tab of your Bitrise app.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Click Edit next to the App Settings section and select the SCIM option using the radio button next to Provisioning.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Click Save.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: A new tab called Provisioning will appear.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Head back to Okta, and select the Provisioning tab, then click on Edit.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Paste the SCIM base URL you copied from Bitrise in the SCIM connector base URL field.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Add userName in the Unique identifier field for users field.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Select which provisioning actions you would like to enable using the checkboxes next to Supported provisioning actions.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Push Groups are mandatory

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Please note that you must enable Push Groups. This is because on Bitrise, Workspace membership works via groups and Okta/SCIM can control our Workspace groups via Push Groups.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Select HTTP Header from the Authorization Mode dropdown menu.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Copy and paste your SCIM authentication token in the Authorization field.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Click Test Connector Configuration to test if everything is working correctly.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Close the Test Connector Configuration window and click Save.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Click the Provisioning tab of your Bitrise app, then click on Edit next to the Provisioning to App section.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Select which provisioning options you would like to enable and click Save.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: Sync password

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: We recommend keeping the Sync Password setting disabled.

title: Setting up SCIM provisioning in Okta
body: That's it! You can now use SCIM provisioning in Okta to manage the access of your users to Bitrise.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: You can push groups from Okta to Bitrise using SCIM provisioning. Pushing a group either links an Okta group to an existing Bitrise group or creates a new group in your Bitrise Workspace.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: Either way, by pushing a group, you set up synchronization between an Okta group and a Bitrise group.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: Log into Okta and click Admin.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: From the left menu, select Applications under the Applications section.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: Select your Bitrise app.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: Click the Push Groups tab.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: Click on Push Groups and choose a filtering method.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: Find the group(s) you want to push.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: You must either create a new group, which will create a brand new group in your Bitrise Workspace or link the Okta group to an existing Bitrise group.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: You can choose between these methods using the dropdown menu under the Match result & push action.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: Linking a group

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: If you decide to link an Okta group to an existing Bitrise group, keep the following in mind:

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: If the Okta and Bitrise group names are different, the Bitrise group will be automatically renamed to match the name of the Okta group.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: When you manually push a group connected to an existing Bitrise group, if the group had members who were only added on Bitrise and not included in the Okta group, then they will be removed as Okta becomes the single source of truth.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: Click Save.

title: Pushing Okta groups to Bitrise using SCIM
body: When the Push Status changes to Active, the synchronization between Okta and Bitrise is ready. Your group should be updated in a couple of seconds on your Bitrise Workspace as well.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: After pushing Okta groups to Bitrise, you can synchronize your groups and users between Okta and Bitrise. To do so, you must manage the app integration assignments in Okta:

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Log into Okta and click Admin.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: From the left menu, select Applications under the Applications section.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Select your Bitrise app.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Make sure that Create Users and Deactivate Users options are enabled on the Provisioning tab.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Deprovisioning users

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: If you deprovision a user with SCIM, the user will be automatically logged off Bitrise and their PATs will be disabled.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Go to the Assignments tab.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Click Assign and choose Assign to People to synchronize individual users or Assign to Groups to synchronize groups.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Select the users or groups that you would like to synchronize, then click Done.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Domain verification

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: New users without verified domains will receive an email invitation to join the Workspace.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Existing users will also receive a verification email unless you verify your company domain: Configuring domain control.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: After synchronizing your groups and users, you can check the Push Groups tab to see if the synchronization is finished.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: You can also manually push your updates by clicking on the dropdown menu in the Push Status column and selecting Push now.

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: "Push now" overrides the Bitrise group

title: Synchronizing groups and users between Okta and Bitrise
body: Users not included in your Okta group will be automatically removed from the linked Bitrise group.

title: Setting up Ping Identity SSO for Bitrise
body: Add SAML SSO to your Bitrise Workspace using Ping Identity.

title: Setting up Ping Identity SSO for Bitrise
body: This guide provides step-by-step instructions on setting up Bitrise as a SAML SSO application in Ping Identity.

title: Setting up Ping Identity SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO restrictions

title: Setting up Ping Identity SSO for Bitrise
body: SAML SSO is only available for a Workspace with the Velocity or Enterprise Build plans.
